intro: Selago corrigioloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows close to the ground, forming dense mats that help prevent soil erosion. Its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions makes it well adapted to sandy and rocky soils. Selago corrigioloides is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
